citation.article-title: Lebetimonas acidiphila gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel thermophilic, acidophilic, hydrogen-oxidizing chemolithoautotroph within the 'Epsilonproteobacteria', isolated from a deep-sea hydrothermal fumarole in the Mariana Arc
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Lebetimonas (Le.be.ti.mo′nas. L. n. lebes cauldron; L. fem. n. monas a unit, monad; N.L. fem. n. Lebetimonas cell from a cauldron).
Short rods, motile with a polar flagellum.
Able to utilize molecular hydrogen as an electron donor and elemental sulfur as an electron acceptor.
G+C content of genomic DNA is about 34 mol%.
Major cellular fatty acids are C18 : 0 and C18 : 1.
On the basis of 16S rRNA gene analysis, the genus Lebetimonas is related to the genera Nautilia and Caminibacter within the ‘Epsilonproteobacteria’.
Members of the genus Lebetimonas occur in global deep-sea hydrothermal systems.
The type species is Lebetimonas acidiphila.
